titleStmt.title: W. W. Tice to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6736

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.

We would represent that James Higgins & John Lockhead, who have just been fined by the Marshall Circuit Court the former on a charge of retailing ($20) and the latter for tippling ($60) are both very poor and needy, but clever citizens. Said Higgins is extremely poor and has a family of grand children to Support.

The offenses were Committed at a time when there was no Courts here nor enforcement of Civil law. Military rule was the law, and Said parties acted under the authority of military orders & permits from Paducah Post. Said fines Should be remitted. July 1. 1865

W W Tice
Commonwealths Atty. 1st J. D. Ky --

D. D. Thompson
N Copeland
H, B, Williams
H. Peel
F M Pool
C Kuykendall
J W Browntree
James Brandt
John Brandt
J. C. Gilbert
John Peel
E. H, Peel
A. P. Nance
G S Jones
L R Finley
J. H Riley
J E Bourland

Marshall Cir Ct
vs
Jas Higgins
$20
John Lockhead
$60
Remit
2d Oct/65
2 cases
Sent for check
20 July 1865
